name: Aam Panna/Panha (Raw Mango beverage)
description: Aam Panna used to be a staple drink in our house in the scorching Nagpur summer. It is very rehydrating with tons of water, salt and sugar!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon black salt or chaat masala to taste
1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder or cumin powder

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and cube the mango and pressure cook with little water for 2-3 whistles.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel and cube the mango and pressure cook with little water for 2-3 whistles.

recipeInstructions.text: Once cooled, blend the mango in a blender to make puree.
recipeInstructions.name: Once cooled, blend the mango in a blender to make puree.

recipeInstructions.text: Add grated jaggery or sugar, salt, black pepper, black salt and blend again.
recipeInstructions.name: Add grated jaggery or sugar, salt, black pepper, black salt and blend again.

recipeInstructions.text: For variation in taste, add cardamom powder Or cumin powder but not both.
recipeInstructions.name: For variation in taste, add cardamom powder Or cumin powder but not both.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rest of the water and crushed/chopped mint leaf and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the rest of the water and crushed/chopped mint leaf and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add lemon juice if needed. I used lemon juice because my mango was semi-ripe and not sour enough.
recipeInstructions.name: Add lemon juice if needed. I used lemon juice because my mango was semi-ripe and not sour enough.

recipeInstructions.text: If the pulp is bothersome, then strain the drink before serving!
recipeInstructions.name: If the pulp is bothersome, then strain the drink before serving!

recipeInstructions.text: Chill and serve with ice cubes!
recipeInstructions.name: Chill and serve with ice cubes!
